intro: Neochilenia glaucescens, commonly known as the Chilean greenbark tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to Chile and is characterized by its smooth, greenish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, woody fruits. Neochilenia glaucescens is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid climate of its native region. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
